caption: Phenomenal local market with a great selection of food options. Good place to grab breakfast/lunch or pick up some healthy and unique groceries. Awesome service, and their mission supporting local entrepreneurs is really cool. Whatever you came in looking for, you’ll leave here satisfied.

Did online pick up, received phone call and email to let me know as soon as my order was ready for pickup. There was no wait time at all.   The young man was very courteous and friendly while loading my car.  😊
Had a great breakfast sammie with great pricing for delivery!
Best breakfast sandwiches in town.  Great corner store with about anything you could think of.

Great local deli/grocer! They serve Compass Coffee and the shelves are stocked with items from other D.C. owned businesses. Food wise you can’t go wrong. I admittedly opt for sandwiches 95% of the time — the turkey & cheese, tuna sandwich, and Italian sub (OMG THE ITALIAN SUB!!!!) are delicious. They also leave treats out for your dog which is just the sweetest. Highly recommend.
Delicious lunch and breakfast sandwiches!! I love the siracha mayo, it’s nice and spicy. Super quick and friendly service too, Union Kitchen is my favorite local food stop!
Nice little place to get a cold drink or coffee. They also have some grocery items if you want to avoid the big stores.

I live this place. It feels like home. Especially since it reminds me of my childhood growing up here in DC. It’s nice to have a corner grocery store you know you can run in and pick up a few things you need or want. Friendly staff is such an understatement. The staff here rocks and I love them. Great products and good food (I’m VERY partial to the bagel bites) and a cool place to support other locals.

I was walking my dog and decided to stop in for a coffee. I forgot my mask so I poked my head in to ask if they would take my order at the door instead of coming inside like many stores offer. The owner came stomping over and very rudely told me not to come back to her store without a mask AND gloves on. She then proceeded to shove a mask in my hand that she was touching with gloves she had clearly used for other things . I understand wanting to stay safe, we all want to be as safe as possible. But, the attitude she had was inexcusable.
This place is the best! Healthy/vegan groceries and food choices. Locally sourced across the board. I love their breakfast sandwiches and their chicken and Brussels salad bowl!!

Introduced to UKG through H street resident.  Learned about DC Food Accelerator Program while dining on creative and delicious sandwiches.  Bought Veggie Confetti pickled cabbage and jalapeño bags to go with my homemade falafel.  Friendly staff.  Worth a field trip!
Excellent service friendly and helpful. It is a full market with a long variety of wines and beers and many more items that you would find in a gourmet market
Best iced coffees, sandwiches, and blind dog cookies in DC. Wish they brought back the yam donuts. They flew off the shelves when they had them for 2 weeks.

This unassuming neighborhood spot tucked just behind Union Station has arguably some of the best sandwiches in the entire city but we order from the entire menu as well. The staff is friendly and the space itself is clean. Very little indoor seating so really more of a takeout place. If you’re in the area make it a point to stop in here.
The best food, iced coffee, employees & owner! So grateful to live near this awesome store
I really liked the quality of their sandwiches and the selection of local food and drinks.
Great sandwiches, coffee, and breakfast spot.

A unique local eat, Union kitchen puts some down-home flair on some big city eats. Great prices for a variety of freshly made sandwiches. Locally sourced baked goods and chocolates will round out your lunch or dinner with some sweet eats.  A great place to go for a quick bite. Even with limited seating, the atmosphere is laid back and you can have your sandwiche before your on the move again. Both thumbs waaaaay up!

Great local market! A bit small and hard to navigate the aisles is the only thing holding back from 4 stars. Great selection of organic produce, good bulk selections and free fruit samples by the door. I love supporting family businesses.

This place is awesome, and my new work lunch spot.  I was introduced to Union Market when I bought gift certificates through the Powell Elementary School auction.  Thank you Union Kitchen for donating.  The sandwiches are made fresh to order, I think the turkey on my turkey club was sliced fresh to order, or at least it tasted like it.  My buddy got the italian club, and he loved it.  Best of all, the staff are polite and just great people.  Don't forget to order a giant chocolate chip cookie!  I'll be back soon.
Used to like this place until they stopped selling bagels. The brioche, egg and cheese is kind of small and dry, in my opinion. Staff is super kind though
Really good empanadas and chocolate chip cookies

Small selection isn't a problem here.  Went for breakfast sandwiches a few times, and they are very tasty and quick.  Good coffee and a cozy nook to eat in, unless you sit on the patio if it is nice out.  Also a great little grocery store with mostly local and natural foods.  Good spot to pick up some local beers and wine.
We had coffee and quiche (by Whisked!) for breffus. It was delicious. Place has a nice neighborhood feel to it too!!!
Lots of local products - they have a small bench near a window where you can sit (with wifi) and a few tables outside!
Perfect

The most stale bagel I have ever tried to eat. I got the ham and cheddar breakfast sandwich and I am struggling to eat it because the bagel is so hard. I will NEVER go back here. If you want a cheap but good breakfast sandwich, go to Cafe Cozy Corner instead, just a 2 minute walk away on 10th & M.
Lots of local products. Their sandwiches are amazing. Pictured is a menu as of August 2017. Their cookies are placed right by the register and they get me every time! Also their ice mochas are top 5
Good food with a high price
Great coffee and fast service. Unique grocery items, also the staples.
Good selection in beers. Nice sandwich

Excellent cappucinos (think Peregrine, better than Starbucks) surprisingly extensive beer selection, and top notch croissant (I think flown daily from France?). All with home/neighborhoody feel (once saved my daughters lost bunny! Thanks Clarice)

I have been getting the turkey club fairly often for the past few months and it's been amazing until today.  Today I ordered it and received a skimpy version with more bread and MUCH less meat.  It was not worth the $12 that they were charging.  I informed the staff that the sandwich seemed a lot skimpier and was told that management made changes to the serving sizes.  The staff was great and agreed to add more meat and apologized.  I hope management realizes that their change to the portions is not acceptable to its patrons.
Great sandwiches!
Cool
Excellent quality lunch sandwiches, but a small selection to choose from. Paper and pencil ordering system was in disarray (numbers out of order) last time we were there (odd).

This is an awesome neighborhood spot! Although the regular produce and grocery items are not worth their marked-up price here (compare the Nutella prices with what you'd get at Giant...it's a little more), it is a great place to buy Made-In-DC goods. They have a nice selection of locally made cards and posters, as well as goods like Chups, Element Shrub, and Cookie Jar. I like buying these products here, to support local makers.
I like the vision this kitchen stand for it!
Get the cookies. Form a cookie addiction. Become obese from cookie addiction. Die young because of type 2 diabetes brought on by cookie addiction.  Life well lived.

I had the turkey club and it's humongous! My picture is of half the turkey club. It was delicious; if I ordered it again, I'd ask for less mayo; otherwise, very satisfied.  I love this place.  Great place to explore interesting new foods and ingredients.  Wish there were more corner stores of all price points in the city.
Great local fare. Friendly staff. Their chocolate chip cookies may be the best I've had.

The woman taking my order was rude. I ordered a red eye (hot coffee) and was handed it without a sleeve. The sleeves are over by the milk. I guess they didn't think that one out. I really wanted to write this review because the woman taking my order was such a batch.

Everyone who works here is super chill & super nice. I wish I had the metabolism & the money to eat UKG's muffins every single day. They are so good - get there when they open, and they'll even be sorta warm, too! These aren't your average from the box, oily muffins.. these are fresh and amazing. Also, the coffee is fantastic. I love the Avocado Toast and the lunch sandwiches, too. There is a fantastic mural on the side of the building from a lovely DC artist. I'm sure they re-stock the mac & cheese all the time thanks to me, too. They also have pre-made grain bowls & salads - great for dinner on the go. Other staples, pantry supplies, and household basics are there too. Love this place!!!!
Great sandwiches, pantry essentials and a little seating area inside as well as outside
Unique selection of good food at this tiny corner store. They also serve delicious fresh sandwiches, coffee and pastries.A valuable asset to the neighborhood.

(Translated by Google) Because the school work came to DC. I chose this solution for breakfast. I feel very relaxed without any pressure to order. The boss is very friendly and the coffee is very good! There is also a wireless network that can be recharged. It is also a small shop that can buy the ingredients you need every day.  (Original) 因爲學校作業來到DC.早餐我選擇這間解決，我感覺很輕鬆沒有任何訂餐的壓力，老闆很友善，咖啡很好喝啊！有無綫線網路也能充電，這裡也是小型商店能買日常所需的食材，很親民的個性小店
They have lots of local and craft foods, and a small but yummy lunch menu. Not sure about other times of day. Small, and fairly crowded at lunch time, they were fast. Got Watermelon Salad, delicious!
Awesome vibe
Great sandwiches. I've had the chicken salad and the but and both were tasty. Two negatives. They stop brewing hot coffee after noon. If you want your sandwich bread toasted, it's an extra dollar.
Small neighborhood grocery store with some staples and items produced in Union Kitchen.  They also serve coffee.

Great place to have in the area with very decent coffee, sandwiches,  fresh produce,  beer and wine selection, and just about all the canned/pantry items you'd need in a pinch.  Also outdoor seating.  Looking forward to stopping by often.

For some reason they don't have a phone number posted.  I need raw macadamia nuts, and would have bought all my groceries at Union if I had any way to call them and confirm that they have the macadamia nuts.  Instead I will be heading elsewhere.  I will make a conscious effort to avoid this place in the future given that they aren't organized enough to include a phone number on the website.
Hyperlocal, deli and top of the line pantry fillers.

I feel lucky that Union Kitchen Grocery is in my neighborhood (Well, more than less. You can easily take a Capital Bikeshare from Capitol Hill East to Union Kitchen Grocery). Powered by DC's beloved Union Kitchen, Union Kitchen Grocery is like a hipster/yuppie bodega. It's close to Union Station and comes complete with DC made products and organic and natural products. If you need some fresh produce or a package of Krave beef jerky, this is your place. They also carry DC local products like Compass Coffee and Honest Tea (started and run just outside of DC in Bethesda). They even have a section that sells basic necessities like cold medicine and more artsy goods like DC art and cards.  The best thing about Union Kitchen Grocery, is that it is a coffee shop too brewing the best of Compass Coffee. My latte was on par with DC favorites like Maketto and Peregrine and my fresh out of the oven giant chocolate chip cookie was the BEST I've had in DC. They have one area of bar seating by the window that seats 6 (or 4 comfortably). They offer free, strong wifi.  To add the icing on the cake, they also support my favorite DC politicians (like David Garber).

Come here for all things local D.C. A wonderful place that showcases the best of Union Kitchen and the blossoming businesses of D.C. I ordered an Italian sandwich and it was very tasty. For drink, I got the Root Punch Tonic juice and it gives you a huge energy boost. The facility has a small seating area next to the window. Staff is friendly and helpful. They sell everything from coffee to dog treats to sausage. Come here to support local business.
